thread.title: Maltese are living a splendid healthy life, report says
thread.title_full: Maltese are living a splendid healthy life, report says

author: Ivan Martin
title: Maltese are living a splendid healthy life, report says
text:
Maltese are living a splendid healthy life, report says Malta's life expectancy tops EU states 
Maltese people live on average 90 per cent of their life in good health, better than any other European country, a new report has found. 
The European Observatory Health Systems in Transition Report, published today, shows "exceptional progress" in the health of the Maltese people, Health Minister Chris Fearne told a news conference. 
The last report, published in 2014, had highlighted a number of challenges and shortcomings. 
But the new report also found that Maltese life expectancy was longer than any EU country. It also refers to the increase in hospital beds and nurses in the Maltese health 
It also refers to the increase in hospital beds and nurses in the Maltese health sector, and points out that Malta's rate of doctors to the number of population is above average. 
It says the increases in longevity are largely due to declining death rates from all causes. Malta has the lowest rate of preventable mortality in the EU, but it also says obesity is the principal public health problem. With 25 per cent of adults obese as well as 27 per cent of children (aged 11-15), Malta tops the EU weighing scales. The full details of the report are being unveiled at a press conference now.
